boardgame.name: Turning Point: Stalingrad
boardgame.description: Turning Point: Stalingrad is mid-complexity wargame on the battle of Stalingrad during World War 2. Attackers from the German 6th Army must dislodge the Russian 62nd Army and take the city of Stalingrad before the commencement of Operation Uranus. If the city could be taken, German troops could then be re-deployed to reinforce the Italian and Rumanian formations holding the flanks of along the Volga. The fiasco at Stalingrad can then be prevented._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is an operational level treatment of the actual streetfighting. Each turn is a day comprising of a variable number of daylight and night impulses. Units are battalions and armoured units representing AFVs in platoon and company strength. The map is on a scale of 1 inch to 500 metres, depicting the city of Stalingrad and its western approaches, divided into 74 areas divided according to terrain features, and rated for defensive suitability. Victory is determined by the number of objectives captured by the German player each week. If it exceeds the requirements for the week, he wins. If not the Russian player wins. If it is equal to the victory requirement, the game is extended by another week, with a different(higher) victory objective requirement._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game comprises two 22_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; by 16_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; mounted mapboards, counters, rules and charts._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game uses the area-impulse system used in Storm over Arnhem, Thunder at Cassino and Breakout: Normandy._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1989 Charles S. Roberts Best World War II Board Game Nominee

This game is listed as part of a group that I am selling to benefit the Sun Tzu Military History Museum. The games were owned by friend who passed this past January, and he wanted to make sure his games were sold to benefit his charity of choice. Many of the games have rules underlining, which I have tried to catalog in the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s condition. I have also tried to give as complete and accurate description as possible. Games are complete, unless otherwise noted. A few of the older games may have handmade replacement counters. Again, I have tried to identify these items in the game description. If you are concerned about specifics of condition that are not in the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s description, please geekmail me, and I will give a very specific accounting of whatever you may have questions on. For any games that are missing pieces, I heartily recommend checking the BGG Spare Parts 2012 wanted/have geeklist. Several users of this site have been very generous in helping find missing components! http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/76707/2012-spare-parts-resource-list Prices are firm on single purchases, but I will consider offers on multiple games. I will ship multiple purchases together to try and save you money on shipping. Photos are available upon request! Local pickup available in the Denver Metro area. I live in South West Aurora and we can meet at a place that makes sense.
